title: Fomepizole Dosing Calculator
description: Calculates fomepizole (4-methylpyrazole) dosing for treatment of methanol and ethylene glycol poisoning. Provides initial loading dose, maintenance doses, and special hemodialysis considerations.

parameters.name: hours_since_last_dose
parameters.description: Hours since last fomepizole dose (required for hemodialysis scenarios)

ranges.interpretation: Follow institutional protocols for IV administration over 30 minutes

references: Howland MA. Antidotes in Depth: Fomepizole. In: Nelson LS, Howland MA, Lewin NA, Smith SW, Goldfrank LR, Hoffman RS, editors. Goldfrank's Toxicologic Emergencies. 11th ed. New York: McGraw-Hill; 2019.
Brent J, McMartin K, Phillips S, et al. Fomepizole for the treatment of ethylene glycol poisoning. N Engl J Med. 1999;340(11):832-838.
Brent J, McMartin K, Phillips S, et al. Fomepizole for the treatment of methanol poisoning. N Engl J Med. 2001;344(6):424-429.
Antizol (fomepizole) package insert. Cumberland Pharmaceuticals Inc. Nashville, TN; 2020.
formula: Initial: 15 mg/kg IV; Maintenance (no dialysis): 10 mg/kg q12h Ã— 4 doses, then 15 mg/kg q12h; During dialysis: 10 mg/kg q4h or continuous infusion 1-1.5 mg/kg/h; Post-dialysis: depends on time since last dose
notes: All doses should be administered intravenously over 30 minutes
Mix with at least 100 mL of sterile 0.9% sodium chloride or dextrose 5% injection
Monitor for side effects including nausea, dizziness, and headache
Treatment endpoint: ethylene glycol/methanol concentrations undetectable or <20 mg/dL with normal pH and asymptomatic patient
For hemodialysis patients: dosing frequency changes due to drug removal during dialysis
Contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to fomepizole or other pyrazoles
